headline.main: Exclusive: Clinton Campaign Also Hacked in Attacks on Democrats

docs.snippet: Lee Saunders, president of the biggest unions in the United States, has become an increasingly important voice in Washington. But that may no longer have the same currency it once did....
docs.lead_paragraph: Lee Saunders, president of the biggest unions in the United States, has become an increasingly important voice in Washington. But that may no longer have the same currency it once did.
docs.abstract: Lee Saunders, president of 1.6-million-member union American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees, is becoming increasingly important Washington power broker; is pushing for progressive goals even as unions face relentless pressure from conservative activists and politicians.

headline.main: A Power Broker Who Wants Labor at the Table, Not on the Menu

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees

docs.snippet: Two former New York mayors, Michael R. Bloomberg and Rudolph W. Giuliani, spoke in featured spots at one of the political conventions. Their messages could not have been more different....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two former New York mayors, Michael R. Bloomberg and Rudolph W. Giuliani, spoke in featured spots at one of the political conventions. Their messages could not have been more different.
docs.abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column contrasts speeches by former New York City mayors Rudolph W Giuliani and Michael R Bloomberg given at national political conventions; holds Giuliani stoked fear and Bloomberg urged calm.

headline.main: Another Ex-Mayor Takes the Stage, but This Time, to Ease an Anxious Nation
headline.print_headline: Another Ex-Mayor Takes the Stage, but This Time, to Ease an Anxious Nation

docs.snippet: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump said is reasserting that whoever hacked the Democratic National Committee and stole years of internal emails remains a mystery. But private security experts — although not yet any U.S. government ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump said is reasserting that whoever hacked the Democratic National Committee and stole years of internal emails remains a mystery. But private security experts — although not yet any U.S. government agencies — say they found persuasive clues that point to hacking groups whose previous targets track closely with the strategic interests of Russia's government, especially its civilian and military intelligence and security agencies.

headline.main: Clues in DNC Hacking Point to Russia, Despite Trump Claims
headline.print_headline: Clues in DNC Hacking Point to Russia, Despite Trump Claims

docs.snippet: The commentator talks about his two-week foray into blogging about the two party conventions, after a long hiatus for meditation and work on a spiritual memoir....
docs.lead_paragraph: The commentator talks about his two-week foray into blogging about the two party conventions, after a long hiatus for meditation and work on a spiritual memoir.
docs.abstract: Edited excerpts from conversation with journalist and pioneering blogger Andrew Sullivan, who discusses his return to media world to cover presidential election.

headline.main: Andrew Sullivan on His Brief Return to the Online Political Fray
headline.print_headline: Back Into the Online Fray, After Spiritual Reflection

docs.snippet: Many people are willing to move away from international economic engagement even as experts overwhelmingly call for a different approach....
docs.lead_paragraph: Many people are willing to move away from international economic engagement even as experts overwhelmingly call for a different approach.
docs.abstract: The Upshot; N Gregory Mankiw Economic View column examines why people see globalization and free market trade as bad despite contrary evidence from experts; cites research by political science professors indicating trade skeptics tend to embrace national policies that consider issues beyond economics and hold isolationistic, nationalistic and ethnocentric beliefs.

headline.main: Why Voters Don’t Buy It When Economists Say Global Trade Is Good
headline.print_headline: Trade Is Good, but Voters Aren’t Buying It

docs.snippet: During a visit from Singapore's prime minister on Tuesday, President Barack Obama will extol the Trans-Pacific Partnership (TPP) trade deal and commit to getting the deal done, a top White House official said on Friday, even though Obama's fellow ...
docs.lead_paragraph: During a visit from Singapore's prime minister on Tuesday, President Barack Obama will extol the Trans-Pacific Partnership (TPP) trade deal and commit to getting the deal done, a top White House official said on Friday, even though Obama's fellow Democrats panned it at their convention this week.

headline.main: Obama to Showcase TPP After Trade Deal Demonized in Campaign
headline.print_headline: Obama to Showcase TPP After Trade Deal Demonized in Campaign

headline.main: U.S. Court Strikes Down North Carolina Voter ID Law
headline.print_headline: U.S. Court Strikes Down North Carolina Voter ID Law

docs.snippet: A federal judge on Friday struck down a string of Wisconsin voting restrictions passed by the Republican-led legislature and ordered the state to revamp its voter identification rules, finding that they disenfranchised minority voters....

headline.main: Federal Judge Strikes Down Parts of Wisconsin Voter Laws
headline.print_headline: Federal Judge Strikes Down Parts of Wisconsin Voter Laws
